Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: Health & Safety Compliance for Legal Issues
headline: Learn to identify international industrial health and safety regulations and implement them in this free online course.
description: This short course is designed for compliance professionals, safety executives and industrial health and safety beginners. It will help you understand different organizational health and safety nuances. In addition, you will learn to appreciate the legal language used in international health and safety regulations. Moreover, you will also be able to implement the requirements of these regulations in your own industries.
courseDescription:
Occupational health and safety are considered two of the most important aspects of any industry's management. Without a solid health and safety policy, organizations cannot thrive and can easily be charged with violating the local laws should transgressions occur. One of the important drawbacks of this lack of understanding and implementation of a sound policy is the possibility of employee injury and death, which could lead to the defamation of the organization where this occurred.

The experts at Exoexcellence Consultants understand the need to bridge the gaps between understanding the health and safety legislation and the legal compliances. That is why they have developed this course on organizational health, safety and the issues related to their legal compliance. In this course, you will find discussions on civil and criminal laws and their links with organizational health and safety. In addition, you will learn to identify the situations where you can apply these laws.

The course also contains essential phrases from the UK and USA health and safety legislation. It includes several vital sections to help you understand their implications so that you can enforce the same rules in your workplace. The course's topics contain a few questions at their end. These questions will help you refresh your knowledge after completing each section. Lastly, you must take a brief course assessment to enable you to apply for your Alison certificate.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Compare criminal law with civil law.
    • Classify criminal law and civil law based on their characteristics.
    • Identify the cases where you can apply the criminal law and the cases where civil law can be applied.
    • Discuss the sources of statute laws in the UK and the USA.
    • Explain different important legal phrases given in the health and safety legislation of the UK and the USA.
    • Indicate how UK and USA enforce health and safety legislation in their jurisdiction.
    • Paraphrase different sections of the Health and Safety Act and Management of Health and Safety Act of the UK and adopt them in your organization's health and safety policy.
    • Recognize the four important areas of the employer's responsibility toward his employees.

  • The Differences Between Civil and Criminal Law

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Organizational health and safety require a meticulous legislative procedure and the stringent implementation of laws to ensure the safety of the workers. But before delving into the legislation process, you need to differentiate between civil and criminal laws. This is because the health and safety legislation consists of these types of laws. Moreover, further, in this course, you will learn about the responsibilities of employers to their employees. Any negligence in fulfilling these responsibilities can lead to the employer being charged under these civil and criminal laws. 
  • The Civil Law
    • Intends to compensate victims regarding the damage or injury they received
    • The person who received the damages files the claims for damages
  • The Criminal Law
    • Criminal law punishes individuals and organizations with fines and/or imprisonment
    • The State institutions initiate the criminal law, such as the Police

  • The Differences Between Civil and Criminal Law

  • Important Legal Phrases in the U.K.

  • It is important for you to be aware of certain legal phrases used in the Health and Safety Executive of the U.K. These key phrases are
    • Reasonable Care
    • Negligence 
    • Vicarious liability 
    • Levels of duty 

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Reasonable Care
  • Every employer is responsible for providing care to his employees, visitors, public members, and anyone who can be foreseen as being affected by the employer's activities. Employers are required to have a complete understanding of risks in their work and to provide the means of protection against any foreseeable injury, disease, or death. The employers ensure this by providing adequate materials, proper systems of work, and having a competent staff.

  • Reasonable Care
  • Every employer is responsible for providing care to his employees, visitors, public members, and anyone who can be foreseen as being affected by the employer's activities. Employers are required to have a complete understanding of risks in their work and to provide the means of protection against any foreseeable injury, disease, or death. The employers ensure this by providing adequate materials, proper systems of work, and having a competent staff.

  • Important Legal Phrases in the U.K.

  • It is important for you to be aware of certain legal phrases used in the Health and Safety Executive of the U.K. These key phrases are
    • Reasonable Care
    • Negligence 
    • Vicarious liability 
    • Levels of duty

Employers are required to have a complete understanding of risks in their work and to provide the means of protection against any foreseeable injury, disease, or death. The employers ensure this by providing adequate materials, proper systems of work, and having a competent staff.

  • The Health and Safety Act, 1974 Part One

  • This section of the topic discusses some of the important sections from the Health and Safety Act, U.K., 1974. 
  • Section 1
  • This section defines the main objectives of the Act. These objectives are:
    • Ensuring the health, safety, and welfare of the employees at work
    • Protecting the employees from any workplace-related hazards
    • Controlling the use of dangerous substances, such as explosives and highly flammable materials

  • Lesson Summary

  • The Civil Law
    • Intends to compensate victims regarding the damage or injury they received
    • The person who received the damages files the claims for damages
    • It clearly expresses all the rights and duties
    • It is simple and accessible to every citizen
    • It discloses rules in an advanced way
  • The Criminal Law
    • Criminal law punishes individuals and organizations with fines and/or imprisonment
    • The State institutions initiate the criminal law, such as the police 

  • Lesson Summary

    • The person who received the damages files the claims for damages
    • It clearly expresses all the rights and duties
    • It is simple and accessible to every citizen
    • It discloses rules in an advanced way
  • The Criminal Law
    • Criminal law punishes individuals and organizations with fines and/or imprisonment
    • The State institutions initiate the criminal law, such as the police
